newsitem.title: USA: Veritas says stock lower on profit taking.
newsitem.headline: Veritas says stock lower on profit taking.

text.p: Veritas Software Corp stock traded lower Tuesday on profit taking, a company spokesman said. Veritas traded 2-1/4 lower to 56-1/4 in midday trading on Nasdaq.
"It has certainly run up a lot in the last couple of weeks so it may be just a little correction," said Mark Leslie, spokesman for Veritas.

Shares of Veritas have risen sharply over the last month. On August 20 Veritas closed at 34-1/2 before jumping to 48-1/4 two days later after the company said it had formed a licensing, development and marketing pact with Microsoft Corp .

The Mountain View, Calif.-based company was given a further boost on September 3 when it announced a three-for-two stock split. Shares of the disk storage management company continued to climb higher closing at 60-3/8 last Friday.
"It makes sense doesn't it," Leslie said.
